title: Family of Nigerian married to a Pole: We pleaded to see the corpse but her husband hastily sent it for cremation | Nigerian News Headlines Today | Breaking Newspapers News
text:
The family of a Nigerian lady, believed to have been killed in Krakow, Poland, and subsequently cremated by her Polish husband, is appealing to the Federal Government and Polish authorities to intervene in the matter, writes GBENGA ADENIJI 
Mrs. Abimbola Essien-Nelson’s voice over the telephone exposed her grief despite her attempt to conceal it. 
She has been heartbroken following the suspicious death of her younger sister, Mrs. Oluwashola Gaska (nee Adefolalu) in Poland and the cremation of her remains by her Polish husband, Mr. Jakub Gaska, despite the family’s objection. 
The incident has been hard-hitting for the Adefolalus especially as Gaska carried on without remorse after his action. 
Essien-Nelson said, “My sister, Sholly, was born on September 25, 1980. She was such a beautiful baby and my parents, Professor and Mrs. Daniel Oladele Adefolalu, named her Oluwashola…
